term.title: aminium ions

item.text: Cations HR3N+ formed by hydronation of an amine R3N. 'Non-quaternary ammonium ions' is a synonymous term, e.g. prolinium, PhN+HMe2, N,N-dimethylanilinium.

notes.item: If a class X can be hydronated to Xium ions the class Xium ions commonly includes the derivatives formed by the replacement of the added hydron with a hydrocarbyl group. Aminium ions form an exception, made possible by the availability of the class name ammonium ions.

term.sources: 'Glossary of class names of organic compounds and reactivity intermediates based on structure (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' Moss, G.P.;Smith, P.A.S.;Tavernier, D.; Pure and Applied Chemistry 1995 67(8-9) 1307
